relevant_findings.initial_examination: Mild optic disk blurring in the right eye; confirmed mild papilledema.
relevant_findings.follow_up_exam: Increased ventricular size and effacement of the cortical sulci after head injury.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially mild papilledema improved after VP shunt placement; subsequent worsening of condition after head injury with increased ventricular size and symptoms of stupor and vomiting.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No significant change in ventricular size post-surgery; however, chronic headaches persisted.
Increased ventricular size and effacement of the cortical sulci noted on CT head scan.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Condition deteriorated with vomiting and stupor; signs of low-pressure hydrocephalus after head injury.

physical_examinations.date: 5 years after placement of valveless shunt
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chronic headaches persisted; neurological examination showed no deficits.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No hydrocephalus noted on scans; headaches remained unchanged.
